intro: Dalechampia margarethiae, commonly known as the margaret's dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange bracts that resemble flowers. The plant produces small, greenish flowers surrounded by fleshy, colorful structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique foliage and floral display. Dalechampia margarethiae requires well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight to flourish.
